ShortDescription: Adds all numbers in a column.
TypicalUseCase: Basic total over a numeric column.

ShortDescription: Evaluates an expression for each row in a table and sums the results.
Returns the arithmetic mean of a column.
Evaluates an expression for each row in a table and averages the results.
Returns the smallest value in a column.
Returns the largest value in a column.
Returns the minimum value of an expression evaluated for each row of a table.
Returns the maximum value of an expression evaluated for each row of a table.
Counts non-blank values in a column.
Counts non-empty values in a column.
TypicalUseCase: Count non-blank of any data type.

ShortDescription: Counts the number of rows in a table.
TypicalUseCase: Row count of a table or filtered table.

ShortDescription: Counts the number of distinct values in a column.
Evaluates an expression in a modified filter context.
Evaluates a table expression in a modified filter context.
Returns a table with rows that meet a condition.
Removes filters from columns or tables.
TypicalUseCase: Ignore filters for totals or percentages.

ShortDescription: Removes all filters except those on specified columns.
TypicalUseCase: Keep some groupings while clearing others.

ShortDescription: Returns all rows in a table ignoring context filters except report selections.
TypicalUseCase: Respect user selections but ignore visuals-level filters.

ShortDescription: Clears filters from the specified columns or tables.
TypicalUseCase: Modern alternative to ALL for clearing filters.

ShortDescription: Modifies filter behavior to preserve existing filters.
TypicalUseCase: Add filters instead of overriding in CALCULATE.

ShortDescription: Specifies an inactive relationship to use in a calculation.
TypicalUseCase: Activate inactive relationship in a measure.

ShortDescription: Changes cross-filtering direction for a relationship.
TypicalUseCase: Override relationship direction in a measure.

ShortDescription: Checks if a column or table is filtered.
TypicalUseCase: Detect filters to make conditional logic.

ShortDescription: Checks if a column has exactly one value in the current context.
TypicalUseCase: Validate single selection in slicers or visuals.

ShortDescription: Returns the value when the context has one value, otherwise an alternate result.
Returns a one-column table of distinct values.
TypicalUseCase: Distinct list of values in current context.

ShortDescription: Returns a related value from another table.
TypicalUseCase: Use related lookup value in a row context.

ShortDescription: Returns all related rows in another table.
TypicalUseCase: Get related child rows for the current row context.

ShortDescription: Adds calculated columns to a table expression.
TypicalUseCase: Extend a table with additional calculated columns.

ShortDescription: Groups a table by specified columns and aggregates.
TypicalUseCase: Build grouped table for further calculations.

ShortDescription: Returns a summary table over a set of groups.
Creates a summary table grouped by specified columns.
TypicalUseCase: Advanced grouping with expression over groups.

ShortDescription: Joins two tables by combining each row of the first with the entire second table.
Returns the Cartesian product of all rows from all tables.
TypicalUseCase: All combinations of rows for scenario analysis.

ShortDescription: Returns a table with rows from all input tables.
Returns rows common to two tables.
Returns rows in the first table not present in the second.
Performs an inner join between two tables based on common columns.
TypicalUseCase: Join tables using matching column names.

ShortDescription: Performs a left outer join between two tables.
TypicalUseCase: Left join tables using matching column names.

ShortDescription: Returns the top N rows of a table based on an expression.
Returns a table sorted by specified expressions.
Returns a table of distinct values.
TypicalUseCase: Unique value table for further use.

ShortDescription: Creates a table from literal values.
TypicalUseCase: Hard-code small tables in the model.

ShortDescription: Evaluates YTD value of an expression.
Evaluates QTD value of an expression.
Evaluates MTD value of an expression.
Returns a set of dates from the start of the year to the last date in the context.
Returns dates from the start of the month to the last date in the context.
Returns dates from the start of the quarter to the last date in the context.
Returns a set of dates in the same period of the prior year.
TypicalUseCase: Compare period to same period last year.

ShortDescription: Shifts a date column by a number of intervals.
Returns a table that shifts dates in a given interval.
Returns a table with the previous day.
Returns a table with the next day.
Returns a table with the previous month.
Returns a table with the next month.
Returns a table with the previous year.
Returns a table with the next year.
Returns the first date of the year in the context.
Returns the last date of the year in the context.
Returns the first date of the month in the context.
Returns the last date of the month in the context.
Returns the current date.
TypicalUseCase: Use for measures evaluated at refresh or query time.

ShortDescription: Returns the current date and time.
Returns a date value from year, month, and day.
Returns the difference between two dates in given units.
Returns the year of a date.
Returns the month of a date.
Returns the day of a date.
Returns the day of the week as a number.
Returns the week number for a date.
Checks a condition and returns one value if TRUE, another if FALSE.
Matches an expression to a value list and returns the corresponding result.
Returns TRUE if all arguments are TRUE.
Returns TRUE if any argument is TRUE.
Reverses the logical value of its argument.
Returns the first expression that is not blank.
Performs division and handles divide-by-zero.
Rounds a number to a specified number of digits.
Rounds a number up, away from zero.
Rounds a number down, toward zero.
Rounds a number down to the nearest integer.
Returns the absolute value of a number.
Rounds a number up to nearest multiple of significance.
Rounds a number down to nearest multiple of significance.
Returns a number raised to a power.
Returns the square root of a number.
Joins two text strings into one.
Concatenates text for each row in a table using a delimiter.
Returns the leftmost characters from a text value.
Returns the rightmost characters from a text value.
Returns characters from the middle of a text string.
Finds the starting position of one text string within another.
Finds the starting position of one text string; case-sensitive.
Formats a value with a specified format string.
Converts text to uppercase.
Converts text to lowercase.
Removes extra spaces from text.
Replaces part of a text string with another text string.
Checks whether a value is blank.
Checks whether a value is a number.
Checks whether a value is text.
Checks whether a value is an error.
Checks whether a table is empty.
Checks if a table contains specified values.
Checks if a table contains a row with specified values.
Checks whether a column has exactly one filter applied.
Returns a delimited text string of IDs representing the path of a parent-child hierarchy.
Returns the item at the specified position from a path.
Returns the number of levels in a path.
Checks whether a path contains a specific ID.
TypicalUseCase: Check if node exists in hierarchy path.
